com.yworks.yfiles.view

Class CanvasControl

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.control.Control
            • com.yworks.yfiles.view.CanvasControl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ILookup, javafx.css.Styleable, EventTarget, Skinnable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GraphControl, GraphOverviewControl

    public class CanvasControl
extends Control
implements ILookup
    The CanvasControl can be used to efficiently display all kinds of data.

    The control supports high performance zooming and panning of visual content and provides a high level view of the visual tree. The control uses double precision world-coordinates to render items that are composed using a visual tree. In its most simple form the scene graph is a tree-like structure of elements that will be rendered in depth-first-search order.

    The scene graph tree is made up of ICanvasObject elements. Multiple elements are grouped in ICanvasObjectGroup elements. An ICanvasObject consists of a user object and an ICanvasObjectDescriptor that is used by the rendering engine to query interfaces that perform the actual creation of the Nodes, hit testing, and bounds calculation.

    This control comes with a number of default com.yworks.yfiles.view.CanvasControl.getCommandBindings() that work on the view port:

    • ICommand.INCREASE_ZOOM
    • ICommand.DECREASE_ZOOM
    • ICommand.ZOOM
    • ICommand.FIT_CONTENT
    • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_DOWN
    • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_UP
    • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_LEFT
    • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_RIGHT

    The handlers for ICommand.INCREASE_ZOOM and ICommand.DECREASE_ZOOM use the parameter passed to the command as the factor by which the Zoom value is multiplied or divided, respectively. The parameter is not required. If it is not present a default value is used. The handler for the ICommand.ZOOM command needs a parameter. The parameter can either be a number which is interpreted as the new zoom level, or it can be a suitable object. Supported objects are RectD, PointD and ILookup. If a rectangle is specified as the parameter for the ICommand.ZOOM command, the handler adjusts the Viewport such that the rectangle tightly fits into it. If a point is specified, the handler sets the Center to that point. If the parameter implements ILookup, then the handler tries to get a IBoundsProvider from the lookup and uses the bounds obtained from the bounds provider as the rectangle to zoom to.

    All commands can be removed from the com.yworks.yfiles.view.CanvasControl.getCommandBindings() if desired.


    Related Information in the Developers Guide:

    CanvasControl is discussed in detail in the section The Control for Displaying Graphs.

    See Also:
    IVisualCreator, IHitTestable, IVisibilityTestable

        public final ObjectProperty<SizeD> doubleClickSizeProperty

      • doubleClickTime

        public final ObjectProperty<Duration> doubleClickTimeProperty
        The property for the double click time that indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent mouse clicks are considered multi clicks.

      • doubleTapDuration

        public final ObjectProperty<Duration> doubleTapDurationProperty
        The property for the double tap time that indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent touch taps are considered multi taps.

      • dragSize

        public final ObjectProperty<SizeD> dragSizeProperty
        The property for the the area in view coordinates the mouse may stay in before a movement is considered a drag.

      • dragTime

        public final ObjectProperty<Duration> dragTimeProperty
        The property for the drag time that indicates the amount of time that may pass before a mouse movement is considered a drag when the mouse stays within its DragSize area.

      • editable

        public final BooleanProperty editableProperty
        Property that sets the editable state of this canvas. IInputMode implementations should honor this property. Events will still be delivered to the IInputModes, however they should not modify the model.
        Returns:
        The Editable.
        See Also:
        setEditable(boolean)

      • fitContentViewMargins

        public final ObjectProperty<InsetsD> fitContentViewMarginsProperty
        The property for the insets in view coordinates that should be used by the fitContent() operation.

      • hitTestRadius

        public final DoubleProperty hitTestRadiusProperty
        The property for the radius of the area around the mouse in view coordinates in which a IHitTestable may lie to be considered a valid hit.

      • horizontalOffset

        public final DoubleProperty horizontalOffsetProperty
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the current value of the horizontal scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the horizontal scroll bar's value property.

      • horizontalScrollBarPolicy

        public final ObjectProperty<ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy> horizontalScrollBarPolicyProperty
        Returns an ObjectProperty that holds the visibility policy for the horizontal scroll bar. Scroll bars don't need to be displayed in order to move the viewport. This can be achieved programmatically or using special IInputMode instances. The default is ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED.
        Returns:
        the vertical scroll bar visibility property.
        See Also:
        MoveViewportInputMode, getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(), ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#ALWAYS, ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED, ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#NEVER

        public final DoubleProperty maximumZoomProperty
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the maximum zoom level that is valid for this canvas control. This property sets an upper bound for the allowed values of the getZoom(). Default value is 1000d.
        Returns:
        the maximum zoom level.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMinimumZoom()

      • minimumHorizontalOffset

        public final ReadOnlyDoubleProperty minimumHorizontalOffsetProperty

      • minimumVerticalOffset

        public final ReadOnlyDoubleProperty minimumVerticalOffsetProperty
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the minimum value for the vertical scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the minimum vertical scroll bar value property.

      • minimumZoom

        public final DoubleProperty minimumZoomProperty
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the minimum the minimum zoom level for this canvas control. This property sets a lower bound for the allowed values of the getZoom() property. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates. The default is 0.01d but values as small as 0.0000001d are possible.
        Returns:
        the minimum zoom level.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMaximumZoom()

      • mouseEventConsumingDisabled

        public final BooleanProperty mouseEventConsumingDisabledProperty
        Defines whether consuming mouse events during the bubbling phase for this control is disabled or not. If set to true, parents of the CanvasControl receive mouse events in the bubbling phase. This can lead to unwanted behavior, e.g. the CanvasControl losing focus and thus not receiving input events and so on.

        Per default, this property is set to false.

      • mouseWheelBehavior

        public final ObjectProperty<MouseWheelBehaviors> mouseWheelBehaviorProperty
        The property for the behavior of the mouse wheel.

      • mouseWheelScrollFactor

        public final DoubleProperty mouseWheelScrollFactorProperty
        The property for the factor that controls how fast the viewport scrolls when the mouse wheel is turned.

      • mouseWheelZoomFactor

        public final DoubleProperty mouseWheelZoomFactorProperty
        The property for the factor by which the zoom level changes when the mouse wheel is turned.

        The property for the value indicating whether navigation related command bindings are enabled.

      • onMouse2DClicked

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DClickedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the user has clicked on the CanvasControl with the mouse. This happens if press and release happens at the same position.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DDragged

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DDraggedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been dragged over the CanvasControl, i.e. the mouse is being moved while at least one of the mouse buttons is pressed.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DEntered

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DEnteredProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has entered the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DExited

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DExitedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has exited the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DMoved

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DMovedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been moved in the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function. Move events are delivered if no mouse button is pressed. This event will be fired, too, if the mouse does not move but the world coordinates to which the current mouse position maps change. E.g. this will happen if the zoom level or the view point is changed.

      • onMouse2DPressed

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DPressedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been pressed in the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DReleased

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DReleasedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been released on the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DWheelTurned

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DWheelTurnedProperty
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse wheel has turned over the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • zoom

        public final DoubleProperty zoomProperty
        Gets a DoubleProperty that holds the current zoom factor for this canvas control.

        A zoom level of 1.0f will make each unit in world-coordinate space appear exactly one unit in screen coordinates wide. The default is 1.0f. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates.

        The valid range is bounded by getMinimumZoom() and getMaximumZoom()

        Returns:
        The Zoom.@see com.yworks.yfiles.canvas.CanvasControl#onZoomChanged(com.yworks.util.EventArgs)
        See Also:
        getMinimumZoom(), getMaximumZoom()

    • Field Detail

      • SCROLL_BAR_ENABLED

        public static final int SCROLL_BAR_ENABLED
        Constant to describe the state of a scroll bar. When the scroll bar is enabled, it is able to receive mouse input and can be displayed.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • SCROLL_BAR_VISIBLE

        public static final int SCROLL_BAR_VISIBLE
        Constant that describes the state of a scroll bar. When the scroll bar is visible, will be displayed at the bottom and on the right of the canvas control.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • compareRenderOrder

        public final int compareRenderOrder(ICanvasObject canvasObject1,
                                    ICanvasObject canvasObject2)
        Compares two ICanvasObject instances that are live in this canvas.

        The comparison will yield values greater than zero if and only if the second object is rendered after the first one.

        Parameters:
        canvasObject1 - the first object to compare
        canvasObject2 - the second object to compare
        Returns:
        0 if canvasObject1 == canvasObject2
        >0 if canvasObject1 is painted before canvasObject2 <0 if canvasObject1 is painted after canvasObject2

      • fitContent

        public void fitContent()
        Adjusts the view port to fully encompass the ContentRect.

        The zoom level will not be greater than 1.0d (see the remarks). If the view port is limited by the ViewportLimiter the zoom level might be greater than 1.0d to respect the limits.

        See Also:
        updateContentRect(InsetsD, ICanvasObjectGroup), getZoom(), zoomTo(PointD, double)

      • getCanvasObjects

        public final IEnumerable<ICanvasObject> getCanvasObjects(PointD location)
        Returns a list of all canvas objects in hit order at the given world coordinate location.

        The order of the elements in the list is the natural hit test order, i.e. elements painted on top of others will be reported first in the list.

        Parameters:
        location - the coordinates of the query in the world coordinate system
        Returns:
        an enumerable of canvas object that are hit in reverse painting order

      • getContentRect

        public final RectD getContentRect()
        Gets the Rectangle in world coordinates that holds the contents.

        This influences the display of the scroll bars. If the content rectangle is not currently visible in the viewport, scroll bars will be displayed, unless they are turned off completely. Note that in general the content rectangle is not updated automatically but declared as a fixed rectangle. Rather the application programmer needs to set this value or call respective automatic update methods.

        Returns:
        The ContentRect.
        See Also:
        setContentRect(RectD)

        Note that this is not a live view, but rather a snapshot.

        Returns:

      • getDoubleClickSize

        public final SizeD getDoubleClickSize()
        The area in view coordinates the mouse needs to stay in before multiple clicks are considered multiple single clicks instead of multi-clicks.

        If the mouse stays within this within than DoubleClickTime, multiple clicks will be considered double or multi-clicks. The default value is (10, 10).

        Returns:
        The DoubleClickSize.
        See Also:
        getDoubleClickTime(), setDoubleClickSize(SizeD)

      • getDoubleClickTime

        public final Duration getDoubleClickTime()
        The value of the double click time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent mouse clicks are considered multi clicks. The higher the value the easier it will be to double-click. The default value is 500 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        The DoubleClickTime.
        See Also:
        getDoubleClickSize(), setDoubleClickTime(Duration)

      • getDoubleTapDuration

        public final Duration getDoubleTapDuration()
        Gets the value of the double tap time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent touch taps are considered multi taps. The higher the value the easier it will be to double-tap. The default value is 500 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        The DoubleTapDuration.
        See Also:
        getDoubleTapSize(), setDoubleTapDuration(Duration)

      • getDoubleTapSize

        public final SizeD getDoubleTapSize()
        Gets the area in view coordinates the touch pointer needs to stay in before multiple taps are considered multiple single taps instead of multi-taps.

        If the touch pointer stays within this within than DoubleTapDuration, multiple taps will be considered double or multi-taps. The default value is (20, 20).

        Returns:
        The DoubleTapSize.
        See Also:
        getDoubleTapDuration(), setDoubleTapSize(SizeD)

      • getDragSize

        public final SizeD getDragSize()
        Gets the area in view coordinates the mouse may stay in before a movement is considered a drag. If the mouse is moved within this area longer than DragTime milliseconds, the movement will be considered a drag, nevertheless.

        The larger the area the later a mouse movement will be recognized as a drag. This influences the click-sensitivity, since a mouse button release is only considered a click if there was no drag since the last mouse button press. The default value is (5, 5).

        Returns:
        The DragSize.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), setDragSize(SizeD)

      • getDragTime

        public final Duration getDragTime()
        Gets the value of the drag time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass before a mouse movement is considered a drag when the mouse stays within its DragSize area. The higher the value the later a mouse movement will be recognized as a drag. This influences the click-sensitivity, since a mouse button release is only considered a click if there was no drag since the last mouse button press. The default value is 300 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        The DragTime.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), setDragTime(Duration)

      • getFitContentViewMargins

        public final InsetsD getFitContentViewMargins()
        Gets the insets in view coordinates that should be used by the fitContent() operation.

        This influences the amount of visible whitespace in the view coordinate system around the ContentRect after a fitContent() operation. The default value is (10,10,10,10).

        Note limits that are enforced by the ViewportLimiter have a higher priority than these insets.

        Returns:
        The FitContentViewMargins.
        See Also:
        setFitContentViewMargins(InsetsD)

      • getFocusGroup

        public final ICanvasObjectGroup getFocusGroup()
        Gets the HighlightGroup property.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createHighlightGroup() will be called. Upon change the onHighlightGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Returns:
        The FocusGroup.
        See Also:
        setFocusGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup)

      • getHighlightGroup

        public final ICanvasObjectGroup getHighlightGroup()
        Gets the HighlightGroup property.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createHighlightGroup() will be called. Upon change the onHighlightGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Returns:
        The HighlightGroup.
        See Also:
        setHighlightGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup)

      • getHitTestRadius

        public final double getHitTestRadius()
        Specifies the radius of the area around the mouse in view coordinates in which a IHitTestable may lie to be considered a valid hit.

        This value can be queried from within the IHitTestable implementation from the HitTestRadius property. The default value is 3.0d

        Returns:
        The HitTestRadius.
        See Also:
        setHitTestRadius(double)

      • getHorizontalOffset

        public final double getHorizontalOffset()

      • getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy

        public ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy()
        Specifies the visibility policy for the vertical scrollbar.

        Scrollbars don't need to be displayed in order to move the viewport. This can be achieved programmatically or using special IInputMode instances. The default is ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED.

        Returns:
        The HorizontalScrollBarPolicy.
        See Also:
        MoveViewportInputMode, getVerticalScrollBarPolicy(), setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy)

      • getInputModeGroup

        public final ICanvasObjectGroup getInputModeGroup()
        Gets the InputModeGroup property.

        This is the canvas object group where the IInputModes should add their temporary content to. This group by default is in front of the ContentGroup.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createInputModeGroup() will be called. Upon change the onInputModeGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Returns:
        The InputModeGroup.
        See Also:
        getContentGroup(), getBackgroundGroup(), setInputModeGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup)

      • getLastEventLocation

        public final PointD getLastEventLocation()

        Returns:
        The LastEventLocation.
        See Also:
        getLastMouse2DEvent(), getLastTouch2DEvent()

      • getLongPressDuration

        public final Duration getLongPressDuration()
        Gets the value of the long press time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass before a touch down is considered a long press when the pointer stays within its DragSize area. The higher the value the later a touch pointer movement will be recognized as a long press. The default value is 1000 milliseconds.

        Returns:
        The LongPressDuration.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onTouch2DDown(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DMoved(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DLongPress(Touch2DEvent), setLongPressDuration(Duration)

      • getMaximumZoom

        public final double getMaximumZoom()
        Gets the maximum zoom level that is valid for Zoom.

        Default value is 1000d

        Returns:
        The MaximumZoom.
        See Also:
        setMaximumZoom(double)

      • getMinimumHorizontalOffset

        public final double getMinimumHorizontalOffset()
        Returns the minimum value for the horizontal scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the minimum value for the horizontal scroll bar.

      • getMinimumVerticalOffset

        public final double getMinimumVerticalOffset()
        Returns the minimum value for the vertical scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the minimum value for the vertical scroll bar.

      • getMinimumZoom

        public final double getMinimumZoom()
        Gets the minimum zoom factor for this canvas control.

        This property sets a lower bound for the allowed values of the Zoom property. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates. The default is 0.01d but values as small as 0.0000001d are possible.

        Returns:
        The MinimumZoom.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMaximumZoom(), setMinimumZoom(double)

      • getMouseWheelBehavior

        public final MouseWheelBehaviors getMouseWheelBehavior()
        Determines the behavior of the mouse wheel. The behavior can be switched between MouseWheelBehaviors.ZOOM, MouseWheelBehaviors.SCROLL and MouseWheelBehaviors.NONE. Additionally, this property can be configured to perform the action only when the control is focused.
        Returns:
        The MouseWheelBehavior.
        See Also:
        setMouseWheelBehavior(MouseWheelBehaviors)

      • getMouseWheelScrollFactor

        public final double getMouseWheelScrollFactor()
        Gets a factor that controls how fast the viewport scrolls when the mouse wheel is turned.

        Scrolling can work either a few lines at a time (per notch of the scroll wheel) or one page at a time. This is a system setting. This property controls how many pixels represent a line if scrolling is done by line. In case scrolling is done by page, this property has no effect.

        The default value of 5 pixels. To speed up scrolling, set a larger value, to slow down scrolling, set a smaller value.

        Returns:
        The MouseWheelScrollFactor.
        See Also:
        getMouseWheelZoomFactor(), getMouseWheelBehavior(), Mouse2DEvent.getScrollAmount(), Mouse2DEvent.getScrollType(), setMouseWheelScrollFactor(double)

      • getMouseWheelZoomFactor

        public final double getMouseWheelZoomFactor()
        Gets the factor by which the zoom level changes when the mouse wheel is turned. The default value is 1.2.
        Returns:
        The MouseWheelZoomFactor.
        See Also:
        setMouseWheelZoomFactor(double)

        See Also:

      • getViewPoint

        public final PointD getViewPoint()
        Gets the current view point.

        The view point is the point in world coordinates that is mapped to the top left corner point in the current viewport. Setting this point to another value will redispatch the last mouse event as the mouse will appear to have been moved or dragged in the world coordinate system.

        Returns:
        The ViewPoint.
        See Also:
        setViewPoint(PointD)

      • getViewport

        public final RectD getViewport()
        Returns the currently visible viewing region in world coordinates.
        Returns:
        The Viewport.
        See Also:
        getViewPoint(), getZoom()

      • getViewportHeight

        public final double getViewportHeight()
        Returns the height of the current viewport.

      • getViewportLimiter

        Gets the ViewportLimiter instance that can be used to limit the explorable region.

        By default there are no limits set on the explorable region.

        Returns:
        The ViewportLimiter.
        See Also:
        setViewportLimiter(ViewportLimiter)

      • getViewportWidth

        public final double getViewportWidth()
        Returns the width of the current viewport.

      • getVisual

        public final Node getVisual(ICanvasObject canvasObject)
        Gets the Node that is currently visualizing the given ICanvasObject.

        Note that depending on the current state of the viewport and the control no such instance may be available and instead this method will yield null. However if a visual is currently being displayed for the given canvas object, it will be returned. This method should be used with care. Manipulation of the given instance should normally be done through the corresponding IVisualCreator that created the visual in the first place. This method rather serves as a utility method for UI testing frameworks and similar use cases.

        Parameters:
        canvasObject - The canvas object.
        Returns:
        The Node that is currently used by the canvasObject.

      • getVisualCaching

        public final VisualCachingPolicy getVisualCaching()
        Gets the policy for caching Nodes which are temporarily removed from the visual tree.

        Visuals are temporarily removed when they are moved outside the visual part of the canvas (the Viewport) and re-added when they enter the Viewport again. Caching prevents the need to re-build the visuals from scratch.

        Visuals are only cached if this property is set to another value than VisualCachingPolicy.NEVER and if a IDisposeVisualCallback is registered during creation.

        Returns:
        The VisualCaching.
        See Also:
        setVisualCaching(VisualCachingPolicy)

      • getVisualCreator

        public final IVisualCreator getVisualCreator(ICanvasObject canvasObject)
        Convenience method that retrieves the IVisualCreator for a given ICanvasObject.
        Parameters:
        canvasObject - the canvas object to query the visual creator implementation from
        Returns:
        an instance of the visual creator interface
        See Also:
        ICanvasObjectDescriptor.getVisualCreator(Object), VoidVisualCreator.INSTANCE

      • getZoom

        public final double getZoom()
        Gets the zoom factor for this CanvasControl.

        A zoom level of 1.0f will make each unit in world-coordinate space appear exactly one unit in screen coordinates wide. The default is 1.0f. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates.

        The valid range is bounded by MinimumZoom and MaximumZoom

        Returns:
        The Zoom.
        See Also:
        zoomProperty(), getMinimumZoom(), getMaximumZoom(), setZoom(double)

      • getZoomAnimationDuration

        public final Duration getZoomAnimationDuration()
        Gets the duration of the zooming animation. If isZoomAnimationEnabled() is set to true, this property specifies how long this animation takes.
        Returns:
        The duration of the zooming animation. The default is 0.15 seconds.
        See Also:
        isZoomAnimationEnabled(), setZoomAnimationDuration(Duration)

      • growContentRect

        public final void growContentRect(RectD rectangle)
        Assures that the content rectangle encompasses the given rectangle.

        Note that this will not change the view port, it will only change the scroll bars if necessary.

        Parameters:
        rectangle - the rectangle that should be included in the content rectangle

      • hitElementsAt

        public final IEnumerable<ICanvasObject> hitElementsAt(IInputModeContext context,
                                                      PointD location)
        Enumerates all hit elements in the canvas below the given group that are accepted by a given filter using a specific ICanvasContext as the argument to the IHitTestable.isHit(IInputModeContext, PointD) method.

        Hit testing is performed using the ICanvasObjectDescriptor.getHitTestable(Object) instance returned for each visible ICanvasObject in the current scene graph. The enumeration is performed lazily.

        Parameters:
        context - The context instance to pass to IHitTestable.isHit(IInputModeContext, PointD).
        location - the coordinates to perform the hit test at
        Returns:
        a live enumeration of the elements that are hit
        See Also:
        IHitTestable

      • hitElementsAt

        public final IEnumerable<ICanvasObject> hitElementsAt(IInputModeContext context,
                                                      PointD location,
                                                      ICanvasObjectGroup root)
        Enumerates all hit elements in the canvas below the given group that are accepted by a given filter using a specific ICanvasContext as the argument to the IHitTestable.isHit(IInputModeContext, PointD) method.

        Hit testing is performed using the ICanvasObjectDescriptor.getHitTestable(Object) instance returned for each visible ICanvasObject in the current scene graph. The enumeration is performed lazily.

        Parameters:
        context - The context instance to pass to IHitTestable.isHit(IInputModeContext, PointD).
        location - the coordinates to perform the hit test at
        root - the root of the scene graph to use
        Returns:
        a live enumeration of the elements that are hit
        See Also:
        IHitTestable

      • hitElementsAt

        public final IEnumerable<ICanvasObject> hitElementsAt(IInputModeContext context,
                                                      PointD location,
                                                      ICanvasObjectGroup root,
                                                      Predicate<ICanvasObject> filter)
        Enumerates all hit elements in the canvas below the given group that are accepted by a given filter using a specific ICanvasContext as the argument to the IHitTestable.isHit(IInputModeContext, PointD) method.

        location - the coordinates to perform the hit test at
        root - the root of the scene graph to use
        filter - The predicate that decides whether a given canvas object should be considered for testing at all or null.
        Returns:
        a live enumeration of the elements that are hit
        See Also:
        IHitTestable

      • isHit

        public final boolean isHit(ICanvasObject canvasObject,
                           PointD location)
        Convenience method that calculates the hit tests a given canvas object in the scene graph.

        This method queries the descriptor for the IHitTestable for the user object and returns the result of the hit test query. If there is no IHitTestable returned by the descriptor this method returns false.

        Parameters:
        canvasObject - the canvas object to query the bounds from
        location - the coordinates of the query in the world coordinate system
        Returns:
        whether the canvas object is hit at the given coordinates

        Returns:
        true if keyboard focus is within the subtree; otherwise, false.

      • isNavigationCommandsEnabled

        public final boolean isNavigationCommandsEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether navigation related command bindings are enabled.

        By default this feature is enabled.

        This property enables/disables the following commands:

        • ICommand.INCREASE_ZOOM
        • ICommand.ZOOM
        • ICommand.DECREASE_ZOOM
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_DOWN
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_UP
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_LEFT
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_RIGHT
        Returns:
        true if the commands are enabled; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        setNavigationCommandsEnabled(boolean)

      • isScrollCommandAnimationEnabled

        public final boolean isScrollCommandAnimationEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether ICommands for scrolling like for example ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_DOWN, the scrolling should be performed in animated fashion.
        Returns:
        true if scrolling should be animated; false otherwise. The default is true.
        See Also:
        setScrollCommandAnimationEnabled(boolean)

      • isZoomAnimationEnabled

        public final boolean isZoomAnimationEnabled()
        Gets a value indicating whether zooming operations (e.g. turning the mouse wheel, executing ICommand.ZOOM etc.) should be performed in animated fashion.
        Returns:
        true if zooming should be animated; otherwise, false. The default is false.
        See Also:
        setZoomAnimationEnabled(boolean)

        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the change of the horizontal scroll bar when the track of the bar is clicked.
        Returns:

      • longPressDurationProperty

      • lookup

        public <TLookup> TLookup lookup(Class<TLookup> type)
        Description copied from interface: ILookup
        Returns an instance that implements the given type or null. Typically, this method will be called in order to obtain a different view or aspect of the current instance. This is quite similar to casting or using a super type or interface of this instance, but is not limited to inheritance or compile time constraints. An instance implementing this method is not required to return non-null implementations for the types, nor does it have to return the same instance any time. Also it depends on the type and context whether the instance returned stays up to date or needs to be reobtained for subsequent use.
        Specified by:
        lookup in interface ILookup
        Parameters:
        type - the type for which an instance shall be returned
        Returns:
        an instance that is assignable to type or null

      • maximumZoomProperty

        public final DoubleProperty maximumZoomProperty()
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the maximum zoom level that is valid for this canvas control. This property sets an upper bound for the allowed values of the getZoom(). Default value is 1000d.
        Returns:
        the maximum zoom level.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMinimumZoom()

      • minimumHorizontalOffsetProperty

        public final ReadOnlyDoubleProperty minimumHorizontalOffsetProperty()
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the minimum value for the horizontal scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the minimum horizontal scroll bar value property.

      • minimumVerticalOffsetProperty

        public final ReadOnlyDoubleProperty minimumVerticalOffsetProperty()
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the minimum value for the vertical scroll bar.
        Returns:
        the minimum vertical scroll bar value property.

      • minimumZoomProperty

        public final DoubleProperty minimumZoomProperty()
        Returns a DoubleProperty that holds the minimum the minimum zoom level for this canvas control. This property sets a lower bound for the allowed values of the getZoom() property. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates. The default is 0.01d but values as small as 0.0000001d are possible.
        Returns:
        the minimum zoom level.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMaximumZoom()

      • mouseEventConsumingDisabledProperty

        public final BooleanProperty mouseEventConsumingDisabledProperty()
        Defines whether consuming mouse events during the bubbling phase for this control is disabled or not. If set to true, parents of the CanvasControl receive mouse events in the bubbling phase. This can lead to unwanted behavior, e.g. the CanvasControl losing focus and thus not receiving input events and so on.

        Per default, this property is set to false.

      • mouseWheelBehaviorProperty

        public final ObjectProperty<MouseWheelBehaviors> mouseWheelBehaviorProperty()
        The property for the behavior of the mouse wheel.

      • mouseWheelScroll

        protected void mouseWheelScroll(Mouse2DEvent e)
        This method will be called by the onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent) method, if the MouseWheelBehavior property is set to MouseWheelBehaviors.SCROLL.

        This method will scroll the view in vertical direction. If the Shift key modifier has been pressed this method will scroll in horizontal direction.

        Parameters:
        e - the event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent), getMouseWheelBehavior(), getMouseWheelScrollFactor()

      • mouseWheelScrollFactorProperty

        public final DoubleProperty mouseWheelScrollFactorProperty()
        The property for the factor that controls how fast the viewport scrolls when the mouse wheel is turned.

      • mouseWheelZoom

        protected void mouseWheelZoom(Mouse2DEvent e)
        This method will be called by the onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent) method, if the MouseWheelBehavior property is set to MouseWheelBehaviors.ZOOM.

        This method will adjust the current zoom level. If the Control key modifier has been pressed this method will keep the world coordinates at the current mouse position, i.e. the zoom will not necessarily be into the center of the canvas.

        Parameters:
        e - the event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent), getMouseWheelBehavior()

      • mouseWheelZoomFactorProperty

        public final DoubleProperty mouseWheelZoomFactorProperty()
        The property for the factor by which the zoom level changes when the mouse wheel is turned.

      • onMouse2DClicked

        protected void onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when the mouse has been clicked. This callback will be called after the onMouse2DReleased(Mouse2DEvent) method has been invoked and only if the mouse has not been moved by a great amount since the last onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent) event. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. Mouse 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DEntered(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DMoved(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DExited(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DReleased(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent)

      • onMouse2DClickedProperty

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DClickedProperty()
        Defines a function to be called when the user has clicked on the CanvasControl with the mouse. This happens if press and release happens at the same position.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DDragged

        protected void onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when the mouse gets dragged. Moving the mouse while at least one button is pressed is considered dragging. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. Mouse 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DEntered(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DMoved(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DExited(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DReleased(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent)

      • onMouse2DDraggedProperty

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DDraggedProperty()
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been dragged over the CanvasControl, i.e. the mouse is being moved while at least one of the mouse buttons is pressed.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onMouse2DEntered

      • onMouse2DMoved

        protected void onMouse2DMoved(Mouse2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when the mouse has been moved and no button has been pressed. If a button has been pressed the onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent) method would have been called. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. Mouse 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.
        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DEntered(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DExited(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DReleased(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent)

      • onMouse2DMovedProperty

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DMovedProperty()
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse has been moved in the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function. Move events are delivered if no mouse button is pressed. This event will be fired, too, if the mouse does not move but the world coordinates to which the current mouse position maps change. E.g. this will happen if the zoom level or the view point is changed.

      • onMouse2DPressed

        protected void onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent e)

Mouse 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.

      • onMouse2DWheelTurned

        protected void onMouse2DWheelTurned(Mouse2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when the mouse wheel has been turned. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. This method will call the mouseWheelZoom(Mouse2DEvent) or mouseWheelScroll(Mouse2DEvent) methods, if the corresponding behavior is enabled. Mouse 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.

        In order to customize the mouse wheel behavior, set the behavior to None. Register to the ScrollEvent and execute the custom action.

        Parameters:
        e - the mouse event describing the action
        See Also:
        onMouse2DEntered(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DExited(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DPressed(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DMoved(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DReleased(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent)

      • onMouse2DWheelTurnedProperty

        public final ObjectProperty<EventHandler<? super Mouse2DEvent>> onMouse2DWheelTurnedProperty()
        Defines a function to be called when the mouse wheel has turned over the CanvasControl.

        An Mouse2DEvent in world coordinates using double precision floating points is delivered to the function.

      • onTouch2DLongPress

        protected void onTouch2DLongPress(Touch2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when a long press gesture has been performed with a finger on the touch screen. This callback will be called after the onTouch2DDown(Touch2DEvent) method has been invoked after a specified amount of time and only if the finger has not been moved by a great amount. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. Touch 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.
        Parameters:
        e - the touch event describing the action
        See Also:
        onTouch2DDown(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DUp(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DEntered(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DExited(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DMoved(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DTapped(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DLostCapture(Touch2DEvent), getLongPressDuration()

      • onTouch2DLostCapture

        protected void onTouch2DLostCapture(Touch2DEvent e)
        Callback method that is called when the touch capture is lost. This method will redispatch the event. Subclasses overriding this method should make sure to invoke the super class implementation. Touch 2D Events use the world coordinate system rather than the view-coordinate system of the control itself.
        Parameters:
        e - the touch event describing the action

        protected void redispatchMouse2DEvent(ModifierKeys newModifiers)
        Redispatches a previously fired mouse event appropriately, e.g. if the view port has changed.

        This is needed to supply IInputMode implementations with the necessary events even if the mouse has not actually been moved.

      • setBackgroundGroup

        public final void setBackgroundGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup value)
        Sets the BackgroundGroup property.

        The background group is the ICanvasObjectGroup that should be used by the application code to put background elements in.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createBackgroundGroup() will be called. Upon change the onBackgroundGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Parameters:
        value - The BackgroundGroup to set.
        See Also:
        getContentGroup(), getBackgroundGroup()

      • setCenterZoomEventRecognizer

        public final void setCenterZoomEventRecognizer(IEventRecognizer value)
        Specifies an IEventRecognizer that determines whether the zooming to the center of the view, rather than at the mouse location should be used.

        The default is IEventRecognizer.SHORTCUT_PRESSED.

        Parameters:
        value - The CenterZoomEventRecognizer to set.
        See Also:
        getCenterZoomEventRecognizer()

      • setContentGroup

        public final void setContentGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup value)
        Sets the ContentGroup property.

        The content group is the ICanvasObjectGroup that should be used by the application code to put actual content in.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createContentGroup() will be called. Upon change the onContentGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Parameters:
        value - The ContentGroup to set.
        See Also:
        getContentGroup()

      • setContentRect

        public final void setContentRect(double x,
                                 double y,
                                 double w,
                                 double h)
        Sets the content rectangle.

        The content rectangle is the space in world coordinates that the user should at least be able to scroll to. I.e. if the area currently visible in the control does not encompass the content rect, the scrollbars will be made visible, unless they are disabled.

        See Also:
        getContentRect(), getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(), getVerticalScrollBarPolicy()

      • setContentRect

        public final void setContentRect(RectD value)
        Sets the Rectangle in world coordinates that holds the contents.

        This influences the display of the scroll bars. If the content rectangle is not currently visible in the viewport, scroll bars will be displayed, unless they are turned off completely. Note that in general the content rectangle is not updated automatically but declared as a fixed rectangle. Rather the application programmer needs to set this value or call respective automatic update methods.

        Parameters:
        value - The ContentRect to set.
        See Also:
        getContentRect()

      • setDoubleClickSize

        public final void setDoubleClickSize(SizeD value)
        The area in view coordinates the mouse needs to stay in before multiple clicks are considered multiple single clicks instead of multi-clicks.

        If the mouse stays within this within than DoubleClickTime, multiple clicks will be considered double or multi-clicks. The default value is (10, 10).

        Parameters:
        value - The DoubleClickSize to set.
        See Also:
        getDoubleClickTime(), getDoubleClickSize()

      • setDoubleClickTime

        public final void setDoubleClickTime(Duration value)
        The value of the double click time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent mouse clicks are considered multi clicks. The higher the value the easier it will be to double-click. The default value is 500 milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        value - The DoubleClickTime to set.
        See Also:
        getDoubleClickSize(), getDoubleClickTime()

      • setDoubleTapDuration

        public final void setDoubleTapDuration(Duration value)
        Sets the value of the double tap time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass within which two subsequent touch taps are considered multi taps. The higher the value the easier it will be to double-tap. The default value is 500 milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        value - The DoubleTapDuration to set.
        See Also:
        getDoubleTapSize(), getDoubleTapDuration()

      • setDoubleTapSize

        public final void setDoubleTapSize(SizeD value)
        Sets the area in view coordinates the touch pointer needs to stay in before multiple taps are considered multiple single taps instead of multi-taps.

        If the touch pointer stays within this within than DoubleTapDuration, multiple taps will be considered double or multi-taps. The default value is (20, 20).

        Parameters:
        value - The DoubleTapSize to set.
        See Also:
        getDoubleTapDuration(), getDoubleTapSize()

      • setDragSize

        public final void setDragSize(SizeD value)
        Sets the area in view coordinates the mouse may stay in before a movement is considered a drag. If the mouse is moved within this area longer than DragTime milliseconds, the movement will be considered a drag, nevertheless.

        The larger the area the later a mouse movement will be recognized as a drag. This influences the click-sensitivity, since a mouse button release is only considered a click if there was no drag since the last mouse button press. The default value is (5, 5).

        Parameters:
        value - The DragSize to set.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), getDragSize()

      • setDragTime

        public final void setDragTime(Duration value)
        Sets the value of the drag time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass before a mouse movement is considered a drag when the mouse stays within its DragSize area. The higher the value the later a mouse movement will be recognized as a drag. This influences the click-sensitivity, since a mouse button release is only considered a click if there was no drag since the last mouse button press. The default value is 300 milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        value - The DragTime to set.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onMouse2DDragged(Mouse2DEvent), onMouse2DClicked(Mouse2DEvent), getDragTime()

      • setEditable

        public void setEditable(boolean value)
        Property that sets the editable state of this canvas.

        IInputMode implementations should honor this property. Events will still be delivered to the IInputModes, however they should not modify the model.

        Parameters:
        value - The Editable to set.
        See Also:
        isEditable()

      • setFitContentViewMargins

        public final void setFitContentViewMargins(InsetsD value)
        Sets the insets in view coordinates that should be used by the fitContent() operation.

        This influences the amount of visible whitespace in the view coordinate system around the ContentRect after a fitContent() operation. The default value is (10,10,10,10).

        Note limits that are enforced by the ViewportLimiter have a higher priority than these insets.

        Parameters:
        value - The FitContentViewMargins to set.
        See Also:
        getFitContentViewMargins()

        Parameters:
        value - The FocusGroup to set.
        See Also:
        getFocusGroup()

        Parameters:
        value - The HighlightGroup to set.
        See Also:

      • setHitTestRadius

        public final void setHitTestRadius(double value)
        Specifies the radius of the area around the mouse in view coordinates in which a IHitTestable may lie to be considered a valid hit.

        This value can be queried from within the IHitTestable implementation from the HitTestRadius property. The default value is 3.0d

        Parameters:
        value - The HitTestRadius to set.
        See Also:
        getHitTestRadius()

      • setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy

        public void setHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy value)
        Specifies the visibility policy for the vertical scrollbar.

        Scrollbars don't need to be displayed in order to move the viewport. This can be achieved programmatically or using special IInputMode instances. The default is ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED.

        Parameters:
        value - The HorizontalScrollBarPolicy to set.
        See Also:
        MoveViewportInputMode, getVerticalScrollBarPolicy(), getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy()

      • setInputMode

        Parameters:
        value - The InputMode to set.
        See Also:
        getInputMode()

      • setInputModeContext

        public final void setInputModeContext(IInputModeContext value)
        Sets the InputModeContext property.

        This context object is passed to IInputMode instances during installation and removal.
        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createInputModeContext() will be called. Upon change the onInputModeContextChanged(IInputModeContext, IInputModeContext) method will be called.

        Parameters:
        value - The InputModeContext to set.
        See Also:

      • setInputModeGroup

        public final void setInputModeGroup(ICanvasObjectGroup value)
        Sets the InputModeGroup property.

        This is the canvas object group where the IInputModes should add their temporary content to. This group by default is in front of the ContentGroup.

        If the field has not yet been initialized upon first access, the factory method createInputModeGroup() will be called. Upon change the onInputModeGroupChanged(ICanvasObjectGroup, ICanvasObjectGroup) method will be called.

        Parameters:
        value - The InputModeGroup to set.
        See Also:
        getContentGroup(), getBackgroundGroup(), getInputModeGroup()

      • setLongPressDuration

        public final void setLongPressDuration(Duration value)
        Sets the value of the long press time.

        This value indicates the amount of time that may pass before a touch down is considered a long press when the pointer stays within its DragSize area. The higher the value the later a touch pointer movement will be recognized as a long press. The default value is 1000 milliseconds.

        Parameters:
        value - The LongPressDuration to set.
        See Also:
        getDragSize(), onTouch2DDown(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DMoved(Touch2DEvent), onTouch2DLongPress(Touch2DEvent), getLongPressDuration()

      • setMaximumZoom

        public final void setMaximumZoom(double value)
        Sets the maximum zoom level that is valid for Zoom.

        Default value is 1000d

        Parameters:
        value - The MaximumZoom to set.
        See Also:
        getMaximumZoom()

      • setMinimumZoom

        public final void setMinimumZoom(double value)
        Sets the minimum zoom factor for this CanvasControl.

        This property sets a lower bound for the allowed values of the Zoom property. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates. The default is 0.01d but values as small as 0.0000001d are possible.

        Parameters:
        value - The MinimumZoom to set.
        See Also:
        getZoom(), getMaximumZoom(), getMinimumZoom()

      • setMouseEventConsumingDisabled

        public void setMouseEventConsumingDisabled(boolean mouseEventConsumingDisabled)
        Sets the behavior of consuming mouse events during the bubbling phase.
        See Also:
        mouseEventConsumingDisabledProperty()

      • setMouseWheelBehavior

        public final void setMouseWheelBehavior(MouseWheelBehaviors value)
        Determines the behavior of the mouse wheel. The behavior can be switched between MouseWheelBehaviors.ZOOM, MouseWheelBehaviors.SCROLL and MouseWheelBehaviors.NONE. Additionally, this property can be configured to perform the action only when the control is focused.
        Parameters:
        value - The MouseWheelBehavior to set.
        See Also:
        getMouseWheelBehavior()

      • setMouseWheelScrollFactor

        public final void setMouseWheelScrollFactor(double value)
        Sets a factor that controls how fast the viewport scrolls when the mouse wheel is turned.

        Scrolling can work either a few lines at a time (per notch of the scroll wheel) or one page at a time. This is a system setting. This property controls how many pixels represent a line if scrolling is done by line. In case scrolling is done by page, this property has no effect.

        The default value of 5 pixels. To speed up scrolling, set a larger value, to slow down scrolling, set a smaller value.

        Parameters:
        value - The MouseWheelScrollFactor to set.
        See Also:
        getMouseWheelZoomFactor(), getMouseWheelBehavior(), Mouse2DEvent.getScrollAmount(), Mouse2DEvent.getScrollType(), getMouseWheelScrollFactor()

      • setMouseWheelZoomFactor

        public final void setMouseWheelZoomFactor(double value)
        Sets the factor by which the zoom level changes when the mouse wheel is turned.

        The default value is 1.2.

        Parameters:
        value - The MouseWheelZoomFactor to set.
        See Also:
        getMouseWheelZoomFactor()

      • setNavigationCommandsEnabled

        public final void setNavigationCommandsEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether navigation related command bindings are enabled.

        By default this feature is enabled.

        This property enables/disables the following commands:

        • ICommand.INCREASE_ZOOM
        • ICommand.ZOOM
        • ICommand.DECREASE_ZOOM
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_DOWN
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_UP
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_LEFT
        • ICommand.SCROLL_PAGE_RIGHT
        Parameters:
        value - true if the commands are enabled; otherwise, false.
        See Also:
        isNavigationCommandsEnabled()

      • setVerticalScrollBarPolicy

        public void setVerticalScrollBarPolicy(ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy value)
        Specifies the visibility policy for the vertical scrollbar.

        Scrollbars don't need to be displayed in order to move the viewport. This can be achieved programmatically or using special IInputMode instances. The default is ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED.

        Parameters:
        value - The VerticalScrollBarPolicy to set.
        See Also:
        MoveViewportInputMode, getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(), getVerticalScrollBarPolicy()

      • setViewPoint

        public final void setViewPoint(PointD value)
        Sets the current view point.

        The view point is the point in world coordinates that is mapped to the top left corner point in the current viewport. Setting this point to another value will redispatch the last mouse event as the mouse will appear to have been moved or dragged in the world coordinate system.

        Parameters:
        value - The ViewPoint to set.
        See Also:
        getViewPoint()

      • setViewportLimiter

        public final void setViewportLimiter(ViewportLimiter value)
        Sets the ViewportLimiter instance that can be used to limit the explorable region.

        By default there are no limits set on the explorable region.

        Parameters:
        value - The ViewportLimiter to set.
        See Also:
        getViewportLimiter()

      • setVisualCaching

        public final void setVisualCaching(VisualCachingPolicy value)
        Sets the policy for caching Nodes which are temporarily removed from the visual tree.

        Visuals are temporarily removed when they are moved outside the visual part of the canvas (the Viewport) and re-added when they enter the Viewport again. Caching prevents the need to re-build the visuals from scratch.

        Visuals are only cached if this property is set to another value than VisualCachingPolicy.NEVER and if a IDisposeVisualCallback is registered during creation.

        Parameters:
        value - The VisualCaching to set.
        See Also:
        getVisualCaching()

      • setZoom

        public final void setZoom(double value)
        Sets the zoom factor for this CanvasControl.

        A zoom level of 1.0f will make each unit in world-coordinate space appear exactly one unit in screen coordinates wide. The default is 1.0f. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates.

        The valid range is bounded by MinimumZoom and MaximumZoom

        Parameters:
        value - The Zoom to set.
        See Also:
        getMinimumZoom(), getMaximumZoom(), getZoom()

      • setZoomAnimationDuration

        public final void setZoomAnimationDuration(Duration duration)
        Sets the duration of the zooming animation. If isZoomAnimationEnabled() is set to true, this property specifies how long this animation takes.
        Parameters:
        duration - The duration of the zooming animation. The default is 0.15 seconds.
        See Also:
        isZoomAnimationEnabled(), getZoomAnimationDuration()

      • setZoomAnimationEnabled

        public final void setZoomAnimationEnabled(boolean value)
        Sets a value indicating whether zooming operations (e.g. turning the mouse wheel, executing ICommand.ZOOM etc.) should be performed in animated fashion.
        Parameters:
        value - true if zooming should be animated; otherwise, false. The default is false.
        See Also:
        isZoomAnimationEnabled()

      • updateContentRect

        public final void updateContentRect()
        Updates the ContentRect to encompass the bounds by all elements in the current scene graph plus the given margins.

        This method will traverse all visible elements in the scene graph and query their bounds The resulting bounds will be set to the content rectangle plus the provided margins.

        See Also:
        IBoundsProvider, getContentRect()

      • updateImmediately

        public void updateImmediately()
        Updates the visual tree that displays the contents of this control.

        This method will determine the Dirty canvas objects using the ICanvasObjectDescriptor.isDirty(ICanvasContext, ICanvasObject) method and will create or update the visuals that make up the visual tree. Calling invalidate() will ultimately trigger this method, however update calls will be coalesced and the actual execution of this method will be delayed.

      • verticalScrollBarPolicyProperty

        Returns an ObjectProperty that holds the visibility policy for the vertical scroll bar. Scroll bars don't need to be displayed in order to move the viewport. This can be achieved programmatically or using special IInputMode instances. The default is ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED.
        Returns:
        the vertical scroll bar visibility property.
        See Also:
        MoveViewportInputMode, getHorizontalScrollBarPolicy(), ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#ALWAYS, ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#AS_NEEDED, ScrollPane.ScrollBarPolicy#NEVER

      • zoomProperty

        public final DoubleProperty zoomProperty()
        Gets a DoubleProperty that holds the current zoom factor for this canvas control.

        A zoom level of 1.0f will make each unit in world-coordinate space appear exactly one unit in screen coordinates wide. The default is 1.0f. If this property is written, the canvas will zoom to the new value while keeping the center of view at the same world coordinates.

        The valid range is bounded by getMinimumZoom() and getMaximumZoom()

        Returns:
        The Zoom.@see com.yworks.yfiles.canvas.CanvasControl#onZoomChanged(com.yworks.util.EventArgs)
        See Also:
        getMinimumZoom(), getMaximumZoom()

        zoom - the new zoom level
